meanings.definition: Not belonging to or characteristic of the aristocracy.
meanings.sent1: The humble farmer lived in a nonaristocratic manner, tending to his crops with care.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood was filled with nonaristocratic families who worked hard for a living.
meanings.sent3: The nonaristocratic cat refused to eat the fancy imported food, preferring simple tuna instead.
meanings.sent4: Her nonaristocratic roots ran deep, like sturdy oak trees in a forest of delicate flowers.
meanings.sent5: The nonaristocratic house stood proudly among the grand mansions, its charm undeniable.

meanings.definition: Opposed to or not supporting aristocratic principles or ideals.
meanings.sent1: The rebellious group held nonaristocratic beliefs, advocating for equality among all people.
meanings.sent2: Her nonaristocratic views clashed with the traditional values of the elite society.
meanings.sent3: The nonaristocratic protest was peaceful yet powerful, demanding fairness for everyone.
meanings.sent4: His nonaristocratic spirit soared high, challenging the status quo with every step.
meanings.sent5: In a world of privilege, she stood out with her nonaristocratic mindset, unafraid to speak up.
